flawed_nl_solution:
If there were beacon towers every 5 kilometers along the 7300 kilometer length of the Great Wall, then there were 7300/5=<<7300/5=1406>>1406 beacon towers.
If every tower had 2 soldiers, then there were a total of 1406*2=<<1406*2=2812>>2812 soldiers in beacon towers along the Great Wall.
#### 2812

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1460, not 1406. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
